info.name: CDR Energy Sector Conformance Tests
info.description:
# CDR Energy Conformance Tests

This collection contains a series of conformance tests for the Consumer Data Right standards applicable to the designation for the Banking sector in Australia.

These tests do not constitute a full functional test of an implementation compliant with CDR standards. It is the obligation of data holders and data recipients to functionally test their implementations fully using whatever mechanism they choose.

These tests do contain comprehensive coverage of the requirements of the standards. A data holder implementation that is able to pass all of the tests in this collection could be reasonably described as conformant to the CDR standards for the Banking sector.

# Conformance Scope

This collection complies with v1.24.0 of the CDR standards.

It includes support for the following API end points:

### Energy APIs

*   Get Generic Plans
*   Get Generic Plan Detail
*   Get Service Point Detail
*   Get Usage For Service Point
*   Get DER For Service Point
*   Get Bulk Usage
*   Get Usage For Specific Service Points
*   Get Account Detail
*   Get Agreed Payment Schedule
*   Get Concessions
*   Get Balance For Account
*   Get Invoices For Account
*   Get Billing For Account
*   Get Bulk Balances
*   Get Balances For Specific Accounts
*   Get Bulk Invoices
*   Get Invoices For Specific Account
*   Get Accounts
    

# Scope Exclusions

This collections does not cover:

*   CDR API end points not listed above
*   Negative scenarios that are not specifically addressed in the standards for individual end points
*   Non-functional requirements
*   Information Security Profile and associated end points
*   MA-SSL configuration
    

# Change Log

| Change Date | Change Description |
| --- | --- |
| 1st June 2022 | Initial creation of the collection |
|  |  |

# Contact Support:

{

Name : Consumer Data Standards

Email : [cdr-data61@csiro.au](mailto:cdr-data61@csiro.au)

}

query.description: Used to filter results on the type field.  Any one of the valid values for this field can be supplied plus 'ALL'.  If absent defaults to 'ALL'
Used to filter results on the fuelType field.  Any one of the valid values for this field can be supplied plus 'ALL'.  If absent defaults to 'ALL'

Allows for the filtering of plans based on whether the current time is within the period of time defined as effective by the effectiveFrom and effectiveTo fields. Valid values are ‘CURRENT’, ‘FUTURE’ and ‘ALL’. If absent defaults to 'CURRENT'
Only include plans that have been updated after the specified date and time.  If absent defaults to include all plans
Page of results to request (standard pagination)
Page size to request.  Default is 25 (standard pagination)Size}}

request.description:
Obtain a list of energy plans that are currently offered to the market.

Note that the results returned by this end point are expected to be ordered in descending order according to `lastUpdated`.

Page size to request.  Default is 25 (standard pagination)Size}}

var dateFormat = "ddd, DD MMM yyyy hh:mm:ss [GMT]";

header.description: (Required) Version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer. The data holder should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If the value of [x-min-v](#request-headers) is equal to or higher than the value of [x-v](#request-headers) then the [x-min-v](#request-headers) header should be treated as absent. If all versions requested are not supported then the data holder must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable. See [HTTP Headers](#request-headers)

Minimum version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer if provided. The data holder should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If all versions requested are not supported then the data holder must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable.

An [RFC4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122) UUID used as a correlation id. If provided, the data holder must play back this value in the x-fapi-interaction-id response header. If not provided a [RFC4122] UUID value is required to be provided in the response header to track the interaction.
The time when the customer last logged in to the data recipient. Required for all resource calls (customer present and unattended). Not to be included for unauthenticated calls.

The customer's original IP address if the customer is currently logged in to the data recipient. The presence of this header indicates that the API is being called in a customer present context. Not to be included for unauthenticated calls.

The customer's original standard http headers [Base64](#common-field-types) encoded, including the original User Agent header, if the customer is currently logged in to the data recipient. Mandatory for customer present calls.  Not required for unattended or unauthenticated calls.
